metadata.title: USN-3733-1 -- GnuPG vulnerability
metadata.description: Daniel J. Bernstein, Joachim Breitner, Daniel Genkin, Leon Groot Bruinderink, Nadia Heninger, Tanja Lange, Christine van Vredendaal, and Yuval Yarom discovered that GnuPG is vulnerable to a cache side-channel attack. A local attacker could use this attack to recover RSA private keys.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-3733-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  gnupg-curl - 1.4.20-1ubuntu3.3 gpgv-udeb - 1.4.20-1ubuntu3.3 gpgv - 1.4.20-1ubuntu3.3 gnupg - 1.4.20-1ubuntu3.3 No subscription required
